summary: Core visitor tracking flow, backend-generated timestamps, admin password login (9533), and UI/table display are present. However, the Excel export relies on an external CDN library (conflicting with the 'no external services' constraint for export), and there are unrequested authentication/authorization systems (Internet Identity + access control + URL token secret) added. There is also a likely timestamp type mismatch between backend (Int) and frontend (bigint) that could prevent timestamp display/export from working.

missing_requirements.requirement: Export actions work entirely in the client (download triggered in the browser) without requiring external services.
missing_requirements.reason: The Excel export implementation dynamically imports SheetJS from an external CDN URL, which requires an external network service at export time.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each record displays a created-at timestamp in the UI (backend-generated), and timestamp handling works end-to-end.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend stores timestamp as Motoko Int (Time.now()), but the frontend formatter expects a bigint. This mismatch could break timestamp rendering/export in the UI.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication flow added (AuthClient, identity provider, identity-based actor creation).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly states no third-party authentication providers and only password-based admin mode; Internet Identity is not requested for the appâ€™s functionality.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend role/permission system with access control initialization, role assignment, and authorization mixins.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only requested a simple password-based Admin mode for export restrictions; a generalized access-control/role system is not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Use of a secret URL/session parameter token ('caffeineAdminToken') to initialize access control.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specifies password-based admin mode only and does not mention any URL token/secret-based initialization.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile management endpoints (get/save user profiles) added to backend.
hallucinated_features.reason: No user profile feature is requested in the visitor tracker requirements.
